result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler N Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Joint and several. Restitution amended to $5,540.32 per 2/2016 Stipulation & Order.

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison funds at a rate to be determined by Dept. of Corrections and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, consumed or sold.  
Defendant shall not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  
Defendant shall have no contact with the victim's family or their residences.  
Defendant shall have no contact with Twan Parham, Randall Lasater, Clayton Selsing, Marlayna Jives, Cassie Engeldahl or Mari Schwendimann.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall notify any medical provider of his opiate addiction.
Defendant shall pay Dept. of Corrections supervision fees.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Sentencing hearing on May 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jane Heather Christopherson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Defense counsel requests that Court rule on State's motions in limine #2,# 4 and #5.  Argument by counsel.  Court grants State's motion in limine #2;  Court denies Defendant's motion in limine #6.  Short recess.  Plea questionnaire filed.  On motion of the State, Court orders Ct. 2 amended to Second Degree Reckless Homicide as a PTAC (with no repeater/no enhancer) pursuant to sec. 940.06(1) and 939.05.  PSI recommended with both sides free to argue.   Guilty plea entered on Ct. 2 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2 as amended.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered.  Report shall be filed two weeks prior to sentencing.  Court orders bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jane Heather Christopherson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Argument by counsel.  Court grants motion to sever.  Motions in limine to be filed two weeks prior to trial.  Court will require counsel to disclose expert witnesses, CV's, as well as any summary of proposed testimony two weeks prior to trial.  Five day jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.
Hearing on October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Jane Heather Christopherson.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Case called at 10:40 a.m.  Court renders oral ruling on Miranda Goodchild motion.  As to the 3-04-14 interview, Court finds the State has met its burden with respect to the Miranda portion of the motion and further finds the statements made prior and up until the Defendant requested a lawyer are admitted and motion is therefore denied. Court finds the Defendant's statements at the 3-04-14 interview were voluntarily made.  Court further finds that any statements made by the Defendant preceding the 3-04-14 interview were voluntarily made.  Court finds the State has met its burden of proof as to the voluntariness of Defendant's statements and denies Defendant's motion to suppress.  Hearing on Bruton and severance scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
